intro: Pternopetalum longicaule, commonly known as the long-stemmed pternopetalum, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Theaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland forest areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
